course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Psychology of Language
course.description: This course will focus on the psychological processes of language use. It includes an introduction to basic linguistic and psychological models and examines the biological foundations of language. Psycholinguistic issues in language comprehension and language production will be discussed. Over the course of the semester, it covers research areas such as speech perception and production, word recognition, sentence processing, and language in the brain.

reviews.author: Pccw
reviews.title: Take this course if you are interested in language processing
reviews.comment_content:
-Introduction to psycholinguistics
-psychological mechanism
-Brain and language
-Speech perception
-The Internal Lexicon
-Second Language Acquisition and Bilingualism
-Language Processing (eye movement and brain imaging)

個人認為最有趣應該係 internal lexicon 同 bilingualism，可惜教得唔太深入，如果有時間睇suggested readings 應該學到好多野
reviews.comment_teaching:
作為一位為普通話為母語的教授，佢講的英文應該係最容易聽得明(好大機會因為佢本身讀language)，內容清晰，上堂都幾多互動 (所以最好真係中意讀先reg)，問佢問題都比到合理解釋，每堂上40分鐘左右有個break。

不過有樣唔好，就係佢臨學期完之發覺應該要比大家睇到lecture video，如果之前miss左一堂就真係冇得睇返。
reviews.comment_grading:
Class Attendance & Participation: 10%
In-Class Quiz: 40%
Written Summary: 20%
Poster Presentation & Submission: 30%

The grading is not good for a HUMA course.
In-class quiz: 37.5/40 (Mean: 31/40)
Poster Presentation: 28.5/30 (Mean: 24/30)
Written Assignment: 18.5/20 (Mean: 15.5/20)
Attendance: 10/10 (Mean: 9.6/10)
Total: 94.5/100
Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
workload 唔算多，佢雖然話有5篇required readings要上堂前睇，但summary只需選擇其中一篇做，而我都只係睇左自己寫summary個篇。

attendance 要開camera，但唔開都ok，不過預左比佢之後隨機問一兩條問題。
in-class quiz 即係 midterm，基本上有溫notes都識，出左小小關於required reading。
written summary 要寫500-800字，不過要煩既應該係點減字數，因為好易寫爆字數都未講到重點。
poster presentation 仲簡單，係十幾篇papers 入面選擇一篇做poster，大部份都做最短個份paper (4頁)，poster 有template，無任何extra design bonus (至少90%既組都照用template)，佢話要3人一組，但基本上我覺得一個人做都ok。

reviews.author: moomin
reviews.title: Interesting course if you like linguistics and psychology!
reviews.comment_content:
You will find it easier to follow if you have some basic knowledge of linguistics.

-Introduction to psycholinguistics
-psychological mechanism
-Brain and language
-Speech perception
-The Internal Lexicon
-Second Language Acquisition and Bilingualism
-Language Processing (eye movement and brain imaging)
reviews.comment_teaching: The Professor tried to make the course interesting and interact a lot with the class. For example, he will ask some questions in the middle of the class and ask us to type the answer in the chat box. He also played some videos related to the concept which was easier for us to understand the concept. The Professor was also willing to answer to student's questions during the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grading. But the mean is quite high. Just pay more attention in class and done all the readings then you will be fine!

-Class Attendance and Participation 10%
-In-class quiz 40%
-Written Summary 20%: Choose 1 article from 5 required readings that will be covered in class (have to submit before it has been covered in class)
-Poster Presentation (group assessed-30%): select 1 article from the list of poster articles, create a poster and present it in class (Pay attention to the details of the reading as you will be asked during the Q and A session!)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fine as the deadlines were evenly distributed throughout the semester. But be sure to read the readings before class or else it will be a bit hard to follow the lectures!

reviews.author: AceOfSpades
reviews.comment_content:
The course is interesting, but it's more inclined towards science than language.

- Introduction to Psycholinguistics
- Linguistics Principles
- Psychological Mechanisms
- Brain and Language
- Speech Perception
- The Internal Lexicon
- Second Language Acquisition and Bilingualism
- Language Processing (Eye Movement & Brain Imaging)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor's teaching isn't bad, but not great either.

Each lecture is organized in an orderly manner. He always made a quick recap on previous lectures as well as reminders on upcoming assignments, if any.

That being said, I felt he might have spent too much time explaining how to use Zoom for attending lessons and the mid-term quiz, which was probably unnecessary given most of us should already be familiar with online learning and the tools that come with it.

Speaking of assignments, both the poster presentation and written summary are simply article summaries except in different format. Personally, I don't think it's the most efficient way to learn psychology-related subjects without giving us opportunities to reflect upon, but whatever.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class Attendance & Participation: 10%
In-Class Quiz: 40%
Written Summary: 20%
Poster Presentation & Submission: 30%
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is mediocre.

We need to submit a 500 to 800-word written summary for a required article of our choosing. Each of the five required articles is covered by the professor at some point throughout the course. Since it's based on the professor's pace of teaching, there is no exact deadline for the assignment and does not strictly follow the syllabus attached. In other words, if the professor finished a topic earlier than intended, the deadline of the assignment to its corresponding required article will also be shifted earlier.

reviews.author: climbclimb
reviews.comment_content:
The content is interesting tho. I felt I need to take a minor in humanities as I am quite interested lol.

Topic 1: Introduction to Psycholinguistics
Topic 2: Linguistics Principles
Topic 3: Psychological Mechanisms
Topic 4: Brain and Language
Topic 5: Speech Perception
Topic 6: The Internal Lexicon
Topic 7: Second Language Acquisition and Bilingualism
Topic 8: Language Processing (eye movement )
Language Processing (brain imaging)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Acceptable, but I don't understand why he used one lesson to teach how to use zoom.
The most frustrating part is he gives comments to every group if there are any mistakes in their poster, but he skipped us since he need to end the lesson. Even though we ask him in a follow-up meeting, he didn't point out any mistakes and say it is alright. Eventually, we got a mean score, and got hummed with a domain less than half of the point. But he didn't mention on any occasion!
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is not good for a HUMA course.
In-class quiz: 33/40 (Mean: 31/40)
Poster Presentation: 25/30 (Mean: 24/30)
Written Assignment: 18/20 (Mean: 15.5/20)
Attendance: 10/10 (Mean: 9.6/10)
Total: 86/100
Grade: B+

I am so frustrated when I know my friend received an A for 88/100, and 87/100 is an A- Just one mark discrepancy will lead to a fall of a sub-grade. The S.D is so small and just a careless mistake will cost you a lot. It's a small class so actually, it is quite competitive if you aim for the A range. I'm so sad after knowing just marginally miss a range saddddd.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not too much. Even though it is an advanced course, the concept is actually quite easy. I just reviewed the lecture notes before the quiz day. The poster doesn't take up a lot of time and the written assignment is just an 800-word essay.
